title: Wireless System Automation  Engineer
summary: You will be part of a dynamic group and have the rare and extraordinary opportunity to craft products that will delight and encourage millions of Apple’s customers. In this role you will be responsible for automation of the bringup and integration infrastructure for the PHY/Radio on internal silicon solution from chip back until shipping in your favorite Apple products
description: In this individual technical contributor role you will be responsible for automation development of state-of-the-art wireless SoC products. You will develop the software infrastructure at the center of a silicon design group including the framework for bringup, validation, characterization, regression, and reporting. This will including designing and implementing a Python based bringup framework, the regression/validation tools, and the reporting/analysis engine. As an owner of the silicon performance infrastructure you will be key in making sure  Apple products exceed expectations.
key_qualifications:
Experience in developing test and debug infrastructure for characterization and debug of real wireless silicon in a lab.
Experience developing test automation including equipment drivers, debug tools, automation scripts, database interfaces, and reporting tools.
Experience automating measurements on wireless test equipment such as signal analyzer, signal generator, and spectrum analyzer.
Basic Knowledge in existing wireless communication protocols: 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax/be, LTE/WCDMA/GSM, or 802.11ad/ay and key Tx/Rx metrics like EVM and sensitivity.
Strong Experience with Python, Matlab, Perl, Javascript, C/C++, or C#
education_experience: Minimum qualification is BS+ 10 years of relevant experience. MS or PHD preferred.
